017package org.microbean.type;
018
019import java.util.ArrayList;
020import java.util.Collection;
021import java.util.Collections;
022import java.util.HashSet;
023import java.util.List;
024import java.util.Objects;
025
026import java.util.function.Predicate;
027
028import org.microbean.development.annotation.Convenience;
029import org.microbean.development.annotation.EntryPoint;
030import org.microbean.development.annotation.Experimental;
031import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingDiscouraged;
032import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingEncouraged;
033
034/**
035 * A value-like object representing a (Java-like) type for purposes of
036 * testing assignability.
037 *
038 * <p>Concisely: {@link Type}s represent {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
039 * java.lang.reflect.Type}s (or other frameworks' similar
040 * representations) without any dependence on {@link
041 * java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}.</p>
042 *
043 * <p>This class is used primarily by the {@link Semantics} class and
044 * its subclasses.</p>
045 *
046 * @param <T> the type of the thing representing a Java type that is
047 * being adapted; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type} or some other
048 * framework's representation of one
049 *
050 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
051 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
052 *
053 * @see Semantics
054 */
055@Experimental
056public abstract class Type<T> implements Owner<T> {
057
058
059  /*
060   * Instance fields.
061   */
062
063
064  private final T type;
065
066
067  /*
068   * Constructors.
069   */
070
071
072  /**
073   * Creates a new {@link Type}.
074   *
075   * @param type the type to represent; must not be {@code null}
076   *
077   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}
078   */
079  protected Type(final T type) {
080    super();
081    this.type = Objects.requireNonNull(type, "type");
082  }
083
084
085  /*
086   * Instance methods.
087   */
088
089
090  /**
091   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
092   * a Java type that has a name.
093   *
094   * <p>In the Java reflective type system, only {@link Class} and
095   * {@link java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable} instances have names.</p>
096   *
097   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
098   * a Java type that has a name
099   *
100   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
101   * and deterministic.
102   *
103   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
104   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
105   *
106   * @see #name()
107   *
108   * @see Class#getName()
109   *
110   * @see java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable#getName()
111   */
112  @Override // Owner<T>
113  @OverridingEncouraged
114  public boolean named() {
115    return Owner.super.named();
116  }
117
118  /**
119   * Returns the name of this {@link Type} if it has one <strong>or
120   * {@code null} if it does not</strong>.
121   *
122   * <p>Only classes and type variables in the Java reflective type
123   * system have names.</p>
124   *
125   * @return the name of this {@link Type}, or {@code null}
126   *
127   * @nullability Implementations of this method may, and often will,
128   * return {@code null}.
129   *
130   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
131   * and deterministic.
132   *
133   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
134   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
135   */
136  @Override // Owner<T>
137  public abstract String name();
138
139  /**
140   * Returns {@code true} if this {@link Type} represents the same
141   * type as that represented by the supplied {@link Owner}.
142   *
143   * <p>Type representation is not the same thing as equality.
144   * Specifically, a {@link Type} may represent another {@link Type}
145   * exactly, but may not be {@linkplain Type#equals(Object) equal to}
146   * it.</p>
147   *
148   * <p>Equality is <em>subordinate</em> to type representation.  That
149   * is, in determining whether a given {@link Type} represents
150   * another {@link Type}, their {@link Type#equals(Object)
151   * equals(Object)} methods may be called, but a {@link Type}'s
152   * {@link Type#equals(Object) equals(Object)} method must not call
153   * {@link #represents(Owner)}.</p>
154   *
155   * @param <X> the type representation type used by the supplied
156   * {@link Owner}
157   *
158   * @param other the {@link Owner} to test; may be {@code null} in
159   * which case {@code false} will be returned
160   *
161   * @return {@code true} if this {@link Type} represents the same
162   * type as that represented by the supplied {@link Owner}
163   *
164   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
165   * idempotent and deterministic.
166   *
167   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
168   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
169   */
170  @Override // Owner<T>
171  @OverridingEncouraged
172  public <X> boolean represents(final Owner<X> other) {
173    return Owner.super.represents(other);
174  }
175
176  /**
177   * Returns the object supplied at construction time that is the type
178   * this {@link Type} is representing.
179   *
180   * @return the object supplied at construction time that is the type
181   * this {@link Type} is representing
182   *
183   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
184   *
185   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
186   *
187   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
188   * threads.
189   */
190  @Override // Owner<T>
191  public final T object() {
192    return this.type;
193  }
194
195  /**
196   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
197   * the uppermost reference type in the type system.
198   *
199   * <p>In all practical cases, if an implementation of this method
200   * returns {@code true}, it means this {@link Type} represents
201   * {@link Object Object.class}.</p>
202   *
203   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
204   * meet these requirements.</p>
205   *
206   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
207   * the uppermost reference type in the type system, e.g. {@link
208   * Object Object.class}
209   *
210   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
211   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
212   *
213   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
214   * and deterministic.
215   */
216  public abstract boolean top();
217
218  /**
219   * If this {@link Type} represents a primitive type, and if and only
220   * if boxing is enabled in the type system being represented,
221   * returns a {@link Type} representing the corresponding "wrapper
222   * type", or this {@link Type} itself in all other cases.
223   *
224   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
225   * meet these requirements.</p>
226   *
227   * @return a {@link Type} representing the corresponding "wrapper
228   * type" where appropriate, or {@code this}
229   *
230   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
231   * {@code null}.
232   *
233   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
234   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
235   *
236   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
237   * and deterministic.
238   */
239  public abstract Type<T> box();
240
241  /**
242   * Returns an {@linkplain
243   * Collections#unmodifiableCollection(Collection) unmodifiable and
244   * immutable <code>Collection</code>} of the <em>direct
245   * supertypes</em> of this {@link Type}, or an {@linkplain
246   * Collection#isEmpty() empty <code>Collection</code>} if there are
247   * no direct supertypes.
248   *
249   * <p>The direct supertypes of a type are defined to be those which
250   * are described by the <a
251   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se17/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.10.2"
252   * target="_parent">Java Language Specification, section 4.10.2</a>,
253   * minus any types featuring wildcards.</p>
254   *
255   * <p>These direct supertypes of a reflective Java type may be
256   * acquired if needed via the {@link
257   * JavaTypes#directSupertypes(java.lang.reflect.Type)} method.</p>
258   *
259   * <p>The {@link Collection} returned must not contain {@code this}
260   * and must have no {@code null} or duplicate elements.</p>
261   *
262   * <p>The ordering within the returned {@link Collection} is not
263   * specified, <strong>but must be deterministic between
264   * invocations</strong>.</p>
265   *
266   * <p>The size of the {@link Collection} returned must not change
267   * between calls.</p>
268   *
269   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
270   * meet these requirements.</p>
271   *
272   * @return an {@linkplain
273   * Collections#unmodifiableCollection(Collection) unmodifiable and
274   * immutable <code>Collection</code>} of the <em>direct
275   * supertypes</em> of this {@link Type}; never {@code null}
276   *
277   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
278   * {@code null}.
279   *
280   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
281   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
282   *
283   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
284   * and deterministic.
285   */
286  public abstract Collection<? extends Type<T>> directSupertypes();
287
288  /**
289   * If this {@link Type} represents a parameterized type or a generic
290   * array type, returns a {@link Type} representing its raw type or
291   * generic component type, or, if this {@link Type} does not
292   * represent a parameterized type or a generic array type, returns
293   * {@code this}.
294   *
295   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
296   * meet these requirements.</p>
297   *
298   * @return a suitable {@link Type}; never {@code null}; often {@code
299   * this}
300   *
301   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
302   * {@code null}.
303   *
304   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
305   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
306   *
307   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
308   * and deterministic.
309   */
310  @Override // Owner<T>
311  public abstract Type<T> type();
312
313  /**
314   * Returns the owner of this {@link Type} as an {@link Owner
315   * Owner&lt;T&gt;}, suitable only for equality comparisons, or
316   * {@code null} if this {@link Type} is not owned.
317   *
318   * @return the owner of this {@link Type}, or {@code null}
319   *
320   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
321   * {@code null}.
322   *
323   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
324   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
325   *
326   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
327   * and deterministic.
328   */
329  @Override // Owner<T>
330  @Experimental
331  public abstract Owner<T> owner();
332
333  /**
334   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
335   * a generic class by virtue of having type parameters.
336   *
337   * <p>This implementation calls {@link Owner#hasTypeParameters()}
338   * and returns the result. Subclasses are encouraged to provide a
339   * faster implementation.</p>
340   *
341   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
342   * a generic class by virtue of having type parameters
343   *
344   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
345   * idempotent and deterministic.
346   *
347   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
348   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
349   *
350   * @see Owner#hasTypeParameters()
351   *
352   * @see #typeParameters()
353   */
354  @Override // Owner<T>
355  @OverridingEncouraged
356  public boolean hasTypeParameters() {
357    return Owner.super.hasTypeParameters();
358  }
359
360  /**
361   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
362   * a parameterized type by virtue of having type arguments.
363   *
364   * <p>This implementation calls the {@link #typeArguments()} method
365   * and returns {@code true} if the resulting {@link List}
366   * {@linkplain List#isEmpty() is not empty}.  Subclasses are
367   * encouraged to provide a faster implementation.</p>
368   *
369   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
370   * a parameterized type by virtue of having type arguments
371   *
372   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
373   * idempotent and deterministic.
374   *
375   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
376   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
377   *
378   * @see #typeArguments()
379   */
380  @OverridingEncouraged
381  public boolean hasTypeArguments() {
382    final Collection<?> tas = this.typeArguments();
383    return tas != null && !tas.isEmpty();
384  }
385
386  /**
387   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
388   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s type
389   * parameters.
390   *
391   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
392   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models a generic
393   * class.</p>
394   *
395   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
396   * meet these requirements.</p>
397   *
398   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
399   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s type
400   * parameters; never {@code null}
401   *
402   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
403   * {@code null}.
404   *
405   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
406   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
407   *
408   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
409   * and deterministic.
410   */
411  @Override // Owner<T>
412  public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> typeParameters();
413
414  /**
415   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
416   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s type
417   * arguments.
418   *
419   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
420   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
421   * parameterized type.</p>
422   *
423   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
424   * meet these requirements.</p>
425   *
426   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
427   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s type
428   * parameters; never {@code null}
429   *
430   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
431   * {@code null}.
432   *
433   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
434   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
435   *
436   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
437   * and deterministic.
438   */
439  public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> typeArguments();
440
441  /**
442   * Returns {@code false} when invoked since {@link Type}s don't have
443   * parameters (unlike {@link Owner}s representing {@link
444   * java.lang.reflect.Executable executables}).
445   *
446   * @return {@code false} when invoked
447   *
448   * @nullability This method always returns {@code null}.
449   *
450   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
451   *
452   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
453   * threads.
454   */
455  @Override // Owner<T>
456  public final boolean hasParameters() {
457    return false;
458  }
459
460  /**
461   * Returns {@code null} when invoked since {@link Type}s don't have
462   * parameters (unlike {@link Owner}s representing {@link
463   * java.lang.reflect.Executable executables}).
464   *
465   * @return {@code null} when invoked
466   *
467   * @nullability This method always returns {@code null}.
468   *
469   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
470   *
471   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
472   * threads.
473   */
474  @Override // Owner<T>
475  public final List<? extends Type<T>> parameters() {
476    return null;
477  }
478
479  /**
480   * Returns the <em>component type</em> of this {@link Type}, if
481   * there is one, <strong>or {@code null} if there is not</strong>.
482   *
483   * <p>Implementations of this method must return a non-{@code null}
484   * result only when this {@link Type} represents a type that is
485   * either an array or a generic array type.</p>
486   *
487   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
488   * meet these requirements.</p>
489   *
490   * @return the <em>component type</em> of this {@link Type}, if
491   * there is one, or {@code null} if there is not
492   *
493   * @nullability Implementations of this method may return {@code
494   * null}.
495   *
496   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
497   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
498   *
499   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
500   * and deterministic.
501   */
502  public abstract Type<T> componentType();
503
504  /**
505   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
506   * either a type variable or a wildcard type.
507   *
508   * <p>This implementation calls the {@link #upperBounds()} method
509   * and returns {@code true} if the resulting {@link List}
510   * {@linkplain List#isEmpty() is not empty}.  Subclasses are
511   * encouraged to provide a faster implementation.</p>
512   *
513   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an override does not
514   * meet these requirements.</p>
515   *
516   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
517   * either a type variable or a wildcard type
518   *
519   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
520   * idempotent and deterministic.
521   *
522   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
523   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
524   *
525   * @see #upperBounds()
526   */
527  @OverridingEncouraged
528  public boolean upperBounded() {
529    return !this.upperBounds().isEmpty();
530  }
531
532  /**
533   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
534   * a wildcard type with a lower bound.
535   *
536   * <p>This implementation calls the {@link #lowerBounds()} method
537   * and returns {@code true} if the resulting {@link List}
538   * {@linkplain List#isEmpty() is not empty}.  Subclasses are
539   * encouraged to provide a faster implementation.</p>
540   *
541   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an override does not
542   * meet these requirements.</p>
543   *
544   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
545   * a wildcard type with lower bounds
546   *
547   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
548   * idempotent and deterministic.
549   *
550   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
551   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
552   *
553   * @see #lowerBounds()
554   */
555  @OverridingEncouraged
556  public boolean lowerBounded() {
557    return !this.lowerBounds().isEmpty();
558  }
559
560  /**
561   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
562   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s lower
563   * bounds.
564   *
565   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
566   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
567   * lower-bounded wildcard type.</p>
568   *
569   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
570   * meet these requirements.</p>
571   *
572   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
573   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s lower
574   * bounds; never {@code null}; often {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
575   * empty}
576   *
577   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
578   * {@code null}.
579   *
580   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
581   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
582   *
583   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
584   * and deterministic.
585   */
586  public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> lowerBounds();
587
588  /**
589   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
590   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s upper
591   * bounds.
592   *
593   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
594   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models either a type
595   * variable, an unbounded wildcard type, or an upper-bounded
596   * wildcard type.
597   *
598   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
599   * meet these requirements.</p>
600   *
601   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
602   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s upper
603   * bounds; never {@code null}; often {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
604   * empty}
605   *
606   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
607   * {@code null}.
608   *
609   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
610   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
611   *
612   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
613   * and deterministic.
614   */
615  public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> upperBounds();
616
617  /**
618   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
619   * class.
620   *
621   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
622   * #named()} returns {@code true} and {@link #upperBounded()}
623   * returns {@code false}.</p>
624   *
625   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
626   * class
627   *
628   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
629   *
630   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
631   * threads.
632   *
633   * @see #named()
634   *
635   * @see #upperBounded()
636   */
637  public final boolean isClass() {
638    return this.named() && !this.upperBounded();
639  }
640
641  /**
642   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
643   * generic array type.
644   *
645   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
646   * #componentType()} returns a non-{@code value} and {@link #type()}
647   * returns a {@link Type} that is not {@code this}.</p>
648   *
649   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
650   * generic array type
651   *
652   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
653   *
654   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
655   * threads.
656   *
657   * @see #componentType()
658   *
659   * @see #type()
660   */
661  public final boolean genericArrayType() {
662    return this.componentType() != null && this.type() != this;
663  }
664
665  /**
666   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
667   * parameterized type.
668   *
669   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
670   * #hasTypeArguments()} returns {@code true}.</p>
671   *
672   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
673   * parameterized type
674   *
675   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
676   *
677   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
678   * threads.
679   *
680   * @see #hasTypeArguments()
681   */
682  public final boolean parameterizedType() {
683    return this.hasTypeArguments();
684  }
685
686  /**
687   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
688   * type variable.
689   *
690   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
691   * #named()} returns {@code true} and {@link #upperBounded()}
692   * returns {@code true}.</p>
693   *
694   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
695   * type variable
696   *
697   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
698   *
699   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
700   * threads.
701   *
702   * @see #named()
703   *
704   * @see #upperBounded()
705   */
706  public final boolean typeVariable() {
707    return this.named() && this.upperBounded();
708  }
709
710  /**
711   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
712   * wildcard type.
713   *
714   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
715   * #named()} returns {@code true} and one of {@link #upperBounded()}
716   * or {@link #lowerBounded()} returns {@code true}.</p>
717   *
718   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
719   * wildcard type
720   *
721   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
722   *
723   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
724   * threads.
725   *
726   * @see #named()
727   *
728   * @see #upperBounded()
729   *
730   * @see #lowerBounded()
731   */
732  public final boolean wildcard() {
733    return !this.named() && (this.upperBounded() || this.lowerBounded());
734  }
735
736  /**
737   * Returns all the supertypes of this {@link Type} (which includes
738   * this {@link Type}).
739   *
740   * <p>This method reflexively and transitively applies the direct
741   * supertype relation (represented by the {@link
742   * #directSupertypes()} method) to this {@link Type} and returns an
743   * {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableCollection(Collection)
744   * unmodifiable <code>Collection</code>} containing the result.</p>
745   *
746   * @return an {@linkplain
747   * Collections#unmodifiableCollection(Collection) unmodifiable
748   * <code>Collection</code>} containing all the supertypes of this
749   * {@link Type} (which includes this {@link Type}); never {@code
750   * null}
751   *
752   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
753   *
754   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
755   *
756   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
757   * threads.
758   *
759   * @see #directSupertypes()
760   */
761  public final Collection<? extends Type<T>> supertypes() {
762    return this.supertypes(this, null);
763  }
764
765  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
766  private final <X> Collection<? extends Type<X>> supertypes(final Type<X> type, Predicate<? super Type<?>> unseen) {
767    if (unseen == null || unseen.test(type)) {
768      final Collection<? extends Type<X>> directSupertypes = type.directSupertypes();
769      if (directSupertypes.isEmpty()) {
770        return List.of(type); // the supertype relation is reflexive as well as transitive
771      } else {
772        if (unseen == null) {
773          unseen = new HashSet<>(8)::add;
774        }
775        final Collection<Type<X>> supertypes = new ArrayList<>(3 * directSupertypes.size() + 1);
776        supertypes.add(type); // the supertype relation is reflexive as well as transitive
777        for (final Type<X> directSupertype : directSupertypes) {
778          for (final Type<X> supertype : this.supertypes(directSupertype, unseen)) {
779            supertypes.add(supertype);
780          }
781        }
782        return Collections.unmodifiableCollection(supertypes);
783      }
784    } else {
785      return List.of();
786    }
787  }
788
789  /**
790   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} is a
791   * supertype of the supplied {@link Type}.
792   *
793   * <p>This method uses a combination of the {@link #supertypes()}
794   * method and the {@link #represents(Owner)} method in its
795   * implementation.</p>
796   *
797   * @param <X> the type represented by the supplied {@link Type}
798   *
799   * @param sub the purported subtype; must not be {@code null}
800   *
801   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} is a
802   * supertype of the supplied {@link Type}
803   *
804   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code sub} is {@code null}
805   *
806   * @see #supertypes()
807   *
808   * @see #represents(Owner)
809   */
810  public final <X> boolean supertype(final Type<X> sub) {
811    final Type<T> me = this.box();
812    // Does this represent a supertype of sub?  Remember that the supertype relation is reflexive.
813    for (final Type<?> supertype : this.supertypes(sub.box(), null)) {
814      if (supertype.represents(me)) {
815        return true;
816      }
817    }
818    return false;
819  }
820
821
822  /*
823   * Inner and nested classes.
824   */
825
826
827  /**
828   * An abstract embodiment of {@link Type} {@linkplain
829   * #assignable(Type, Type) assignability rules}.
830   *
831   * <p>By default, no {@link Type} {@linkplain #assignable(Type,
832   * Type) is assignable} to any other {@link Type} except itself.
833   * Subclasses will obviously want to override this behavior in some,
834   * if not all, cases.</p>
835   *
836   * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
837   * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
838   *
839   * @see VariantSemantics
840   *
841   * @see InvariantSemantics
842   *
843   * @see CovariantSemantics
844   *
845   * @see CdiSemantics
846   */
847  @Experimental
848  public static abstract class Semantics {
849
850
851    /*
852     * Constructors.
853     */
854
855
856    /**
857     * Creates a new {@link Semantics}.
858     */
859    protected Semantics() {
860      super();
861    }
862
863
864    /*
865     * Instance methods.
866     */
867
868
869    /**
870     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
871     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
872     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
873     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
874     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and using no autoboxing.
875     *
876     * <p>This is a convenience method that {@linkplain
877     * JavaType#of(java.lang.reflect.Type, boolean) creates
878     * <code>JavaType</code>s} to represent the supplied {@link
879     * java.lang.reflect.Type}s before calling the (canonical) {@link
880     * #assignable(Type, Type)} method.</p>
881     *
882     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
883     * not be {@code null}
884     *
885     * @param payloadType the payload type as described above; must
886     * not be {@code null}
887     *
888     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
889     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
890     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
891     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
892     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and using no autoboxing;
893     * {@code false} otherwise
894     *
895     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
896     * or {@code payloadType} is {@code null}
897     *
898     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
899     * idempotent and deterministic.
900     *
901     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
902     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
903     *
904     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
905     *
906     * @see JavaType#of(java.lang.reflect.Type, boolean)
907     */
908    @Convenience
909    public boolean assignable(final java.lang.reflect.Type receiverType,
910                              final java.lang.reflect.Type payloadType) {
911      return this.assignable(receiverType, payloadType, false);
912    }
913
914    /**
915     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
916     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
917     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
918     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
919     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and using the specified
920     * autoboxing semantics.
921     *
922     * <p>This is a convenience method that {@linkplain
923     * JavaType#of(java.lang.reflect.Type, boolean) creates
924     * <code>JavaType</code>s} to represent the supplied {@link
925     * java.lang.reflect.Type}s before calling the (canonical) {@link
926     * #assignable(Type, Type)} method.</p>
927     *
928     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
929     * not be {@code null}
930     *
931     * @param payloadType the payload type as described above; must
932     * not be {@code null}
933     *
934     * @param box whether autoboxing is enabled
935     *
936     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
937     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
938     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
939     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
940     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and using the specified
941     * autoboxing semantics; {@code false} otherwise
942     *
943     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
944     * or {@code payloadType} is {@code null}
945     *
946     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
947     * idempotent and deterministic.
948     *
949     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
950     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
951     *
952     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
953     *
954     * @see JavaType#of(java.lang.reflect.Type, boolean)
955     */
956    @Convenience
957    public boolean assignable(final java.lang.reflect.Type receiverType,
958                              final java.lang.reflect.Type payloadType,
959                              final boolean box) {
960      return this.assignable(JavaType.of(receiverType, box), JavaType.of(payloadType, box));
961    }
962
963    /**
964     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
965     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
966     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
967     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
968     * this {@link Semantics} instance.
969     *
970     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
971     * receiverType}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
972     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
973     *
974     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code payloadType};
975     * often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
976     *
977     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
978     * not be {@code null}
979     *
980     * @param payloadType the payload type as described above; must
981     * not be {@code null}
982     *
983     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
984     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
985     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
986     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
987     * this {@link Semantics} instance; {@code false} otherwise
988     *
989     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
990     * or {@code payloadType} is {@code null}
991     *
992     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
993     * idempotent and deterministic.
994     *
995     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
996     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
997     */
998    @EntryPoint
999    @OverridingDiscouraged
1000    public <X, Y> boolean assignable(final Type<X> receiverType, final Type<Y> payloadType) {
1001      if (receiverType == Objects.requireNonNull(payloadType, "payloadType") || receiverType.represents(payloadType)) {
1002        return true;
1003      } else if (receiverType.hasTypeArguments()) {
1004        return parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromType(receiverType, payloadType);
1005      } else if (payloadType.hasTypeArguments()) {
1006        return this.nonParameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
1007      } else if (receiverType.componentType() == null) {
1008        if (receiverType.lowerBounded()) {
1009          return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, true, payloadType);
1010        } else if (receiverType.upperBounded()) {
1011          if (receiverType.named()) {
1012            return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
1013          } else {
1014            return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, false, payloadType);
1015          }
1016        } else {
1017          return this.classIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
1018        }
1019      } else if (receiverType.type() == receiverType) {
1020        return this.classIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
1021      } else {
1022        return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
1023      }
1024    }
1025
1026    private final <X, Y> boolean nonParameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverNonParameterizedType,
1027                                                                                       final Type<Y> payloadParameterizedType) {
1028      if (receiverNonParameterizedType.componentType() == null) {
1029        if (receiverNonParameterizedType.lowerBounded()) {
1030          return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, true /* lower bounded */, payloadParameterizedType);
1031        } else if (receiverNonParameterizedType.upperBounded()) {
1032          if (receiverNonParameterizedType.named()) {
1033            return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, payloadParameterizedType);
1034          } else {
1035            return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, false /* upper bounded */, payloadParameterizedType);
1036          }
1037        } else {
1038          return this.classIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, payloadParameterizedType);
1039        }
1040      } else if (receiverNonParameterizedType.type() == receiverNonParameterizedType) {
1041        return this.classIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, payloadParameterizedType);
1042      } else {
1043        return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, payloadParameterizedType);
1044      }
1045    }
1046
1047    private final <X, Y> boolean classIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverClass,
1048                                                                           final Type<Y> payloadNonParameterizedType) {
1049      if (payloadNonParameterizedType.componentType() == null) {
1050        if (payloadNonParameterizedType.lowerBounded()) {
1051          return this.classIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType, true);
1052        } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.upperBounded()) {
1053          if (payloadNonParameterizedType.named()) {
1054            return this.classIsAssignableFromTypeVariable(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1055          } else {
1056            return this.classIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType, false);
1057          }
1058        } else {
1059          return this.classIsAssignableFromClass(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1060        }
1061      } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.type() == payloadNonParameterizedType) {
1062        return this.classIsAssignableFromClass(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1063      } else {
1064        return this.classIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1065      }
1066    }
1067
1068    /**
1069     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1070     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadClass} is assignable
1071     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
1072     * receiverClass}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
1073     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and if and only if {@code
1074     * payloadClass} models a {@linkplain Class Java class} and not
1075     * any other type, and if and only if {@code receiverClass} models
1076     * a {@linkplain Class Java class} and not any other type.
1077     *
1078     * <p>This method is called by the {@link #assignable(Type, Type)}
1079     * method.</p>
1080     *
1081     * <p>This implementation returns {@code false} in all cases.
1082     *
1083     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1084     * receiverClass}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1085     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1086     *
1087     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code payloadClass};
1088     * often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
1089     *
1090     * @param receiverClass the receiver type as described above; must
1091     * not be {@code null}
1092     *
1093     * @param payloadClass the payload type as described above; must
1094     * not be {@code null}
1095     *
1096     * @return {@code false} in all cases
1097     *
1098     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1099     * idempotent and deterministic.
1100     *
1101     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1102     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1103     *
1104     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
1105     */
1106    @OverridingEncouraged
1107    protected <X, Y> boolean classIsAssignableFromClass(final Type<X> receiverClass, final Type<Y> payloadClass) {
1108      return false;
1109    }
1110
1111    /**
1112     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1113     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadClass} is assignable
1114     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
1115     * receiverClass}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
1116     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and if and only if {@code
1117     * payloadParameterizedType} models a Java {@linkplain
1118     * java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType parameterized type} and not
1119     * any other type, and if and only if {@code receiverClass} models
1120     * a {@linkplain Class Java class} and not any other type.
1121     *
1122     * <p>This method is called by the {@link #assignable(Type, Type)}
1123     * method.</p>
1124     *
1125     * <p>This implementation returns {@code false} in all cases.
1126     *
1127     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1128     * receiverClass}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1129     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1130     *
1131     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1132     * payloadParameterizedType}; often a {@link
1133     * java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
1134     *
1135     * @param receiverClass the receiver type as described above; must
1136     * not be {@code null}
1137     *
1138     * @param payloadParameterizedType the payload type as described above; must
1139     * not be {@code null}
1140     *
1141     * @return {@code false} in all cases
1142     *
1143     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1144     * idempotent and deterministic.
1145     *
1146     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1147     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1148     *
1149     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
1150     */
1151    @OverridingEncouraged
1152    protected <X, Y> boolean classIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverClass, final Type<Y> payloadParameterizedType) {
1153      return false;
1154    }
1155
1156    /**
1157     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1158     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadGenericArrayType} is
1159     * assignable to a reference bearing the type modeled by the
1160     * supplied {@code receiverClass}, according to the assignability
1161     * rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance, and if and
1162     * only if {@code payloadGenericArrayType} models a Java
1163     * {@linkplain java.lang.reflect.GenericArrayType generic array
1164     * type} and not any other type, and if and only if {@code
1165     * receiverClass} models a {@linkplain Class Java class} and not
1166     * any other type.
1167     *
1168     * <p>This method is called by the {@link #assignable(Type, Type)}
1169     * method.</p>
1170     *
1171     * <p>This implementation returns {@code false} in all cases.
1172     *
1173     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1174     * receiverClass}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1175     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1176     *
1177     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1178     * payloadGenericArrayType}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1179     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1180     *
1181     * @param receiverClass the receiver type as described above; must
1182     * not be {@code null}
1183     *
1184     * @param payloadGenericArrayType the payload type as described
1185     * above; must not be {@code null}
1186     *
1187     * @return {@code false} in all cases
1188     *
1189     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1190     * idempotent and deterministic.
1191     *
1192     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1193     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1194     *
1195     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
1196     */
1197    @OverridingEncouraged
1198    protected <X, Y> boolean classIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(final Type<X> receiverClass, final Type<Y> payloadGenericArrayType) {
1199      return false;
1200    }
1201
1202    /**
1203     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1204     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadTypeVariable} is
1205     * assignable to a reference bearing the type modeled by the
1206     * supplied {@code receiverClass}, according to the assignability
1207     * rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance, and if and
1208     * only if {@code payloadTypeVariable} models a Java {@linkplain
1209     * java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable type variable} and not any other
1210     * type, and if and only if {@code receiverClass} models a
1211     * {@linkplain Class Java class} and not any other type.
1212     *
1213     * <p>This method is called by the {@link #assignable(Type, Type)}
1214     * method.</p>
1215     *
1216     * <p>This implementation returns {@code false} in all cases.
1217     *
1218     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1219     * receiverClass}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1220     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1221     *
1222     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code payloadTypeVariable};
1223     * often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
1224     *
1225     * @param receiverClass the receiver type as described above; must
1226     * not be {@code null}
1227     *
1228     * @param payloadTypeVariable the payload type as described above; must
1229     * not be {@code null}
1230     *
1231     * @return {@code false} in all cases
1232     *
1233     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1234     * idempotent and deterministic.
1235     *
1236     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1237     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1238     *
1239     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
1240     */
1241    @OverridingEncouraged
1242    protected <X, Y> boolean classIsAssignableFromTypeVariable(final Type<X> receiverClass, final Type<Y> payloadTypeVariable) {
1243      return false;
1244    }
1245
1246    /**
1247     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1248     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadWildcardType} is
1249     * assignable to a reference bearing the type modeled by the
1250     * supplied {@code receiverClass}, according to the assignability
1251     * rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance, and if and
1252     * only if {@code payloadWildcardType} models a Java {@linkplain
1253     * java.lang.reflect.WildcardType wildcard type} and not any other
1254     * type, and if and only if {@code receiverClass} models a
1255     * {@linkplain Class Java class} and not any other type.
1256     *
1257     * <p>This method is called by the {@link #assignable(Type, Type)}
1258     * method.</p>
1259     *
1260     * <p>This implementation returns {@code false} in all cases.
1261     *
1262     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1263     * receiverClass}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1264     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1265     *
1266     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code payloadWildcardType};
1267     * often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
1268     *
1269     * @param receiverClass the receiver type as described above; must
1270     * not be {@code null}
1271     *
1272     * @param payloadWildcardType the payload type as described above; must
1273     * not be {@code null}
1274     *
1275     * @param lowerBounded whether {@code payloadWildcardType} is a
1276     * lower-bounded wildcard type
1277     *
1278     * @return {@code false} in all cases
1279     *
1280     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1281     * idempotent and deterministic.
1282     *
1283     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1284     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1285     *
1286     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
1287     */
1288    @OverridingEncouraged
1289    protected <X, Y> boolean classIsAssignableFromWildcardType(final Type<X> receiverClass, final Type<Y> payloadWildcardType, final boolean lowerBounded) {
1290      return false;
1291    }
1292
1293    private final <X, Y> boolean parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromType(final Type<X> receiverParameterizedType, final Type<Y> payloadType) {
1294      if (payloadType.hasTypeArguments()) {
1295        return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
1296      } else if (payloadType.componentType() == null) {
1297        if (payloadType.lowerBounded()) {
1298          return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType, true);
1299        } else if (payloadType.upperBounded()) {
1300          if (payloadType.named()) {
1301            return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromTypeVariable(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
1302          } else {
1303            return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType, false);
1304          }
1305        } else {
1306          return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
1307        }
1308      } else if (payloadType.type() == payloadType) {
1309        return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
1310      } else {
1311        return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
1312      }
1313    }

1555    private final <X, Y> boolean genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverGenericArrayType,
1556                                                                                      final Type<Y> payloadNonParameterizedType) {
1557      if (payloadNonParameterizedType.componentType() == null) {
1558        if (payloadNonParameterizedType.lowerBounded()) {
1559          return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType, true);
1560        } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.upperBounded()) {
1561          if (payloadNonParameterizedType.named()) {
1562            return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromTypeVariable(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1563          } else {
1564            return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType, false);
1565          }
1566        } else {
1567          return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1568        }
1569      } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.type() == payloadNonParameterizedType) {
1570        return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1571      } else {
1572        return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1573      }
1574    }

1813    private final <X, Y> boolean typeVariableIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverTypeVariable,
1814                                                                                  final Type<Y> payloadNonParameterizedType) {
1815      if (payloadNonParameterizedType.componentType() == null) {
1816        if (payloadNonParameterizedType.lowerBounded()) {
1817          return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType, true);
1818        } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.upperBounded()) {
1819          if (payloadNonParameterizedType.named()) {
1820            return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromTypeVariable(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1821          } else {
1822            return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType, false);
1823          }
1824        } else {
1825          return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromClass(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1826        }
1827      } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.type() == payloadNonParameterizedType) {
1828        return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromClass(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1829      } else {
1830        return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1831      }
1832    }

1838     * receiverTypeVariable}, according to the assignability rules
1839     * modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance, and if and only if
1840     * {@code payloadClass} models a Java {@linkplain Class class} and
1841     * not any other type, and if and only if {@code
1842     * receiverTypeVariable} models a {@linkplain
1843     * java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable type variable} and not any other
1844     * type.
1845     *
1846     * <p>This method is called by the {@link #assignable(Type, Type)}
1847     * method.</p>
1848     *
1849     * <p>This implementation returns {@code false} in all cases.
1850     *

1852     * receiverParameterizedType}; often a {@link
1853     * java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}

1856     * payloadClass}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1857     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1858     *
1859     * @param receiverTypeVariable the receiver type as described
1860     * above; must not be {@code null}
1861     *
1862     * @param payloadClass the payload type as described above;
1863     * must not be {@code null}
1864     *
1865     * @return {@code false} in all cases
1866     *
1867     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1868     * idempotent and deterministic.
1869     *
1870     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1871     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1872     *
1873     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
1874     */
1875    @OverridingEncouraged
1876    protected <X, Y> boolean typeVariableIsAssignableFromClass(final Type<X> receiverTypeVariable, final Type<Y> payloadClass) {
1877      return false;
1878    }

2021    /**
2022     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
2023     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadWildcardType} is
2024     * assignable to a reference bearing the type modeled by the
2025     * supplied {@code receiverTypeVariable}, according to the
2026     * assignability rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance,
2027     * and if and only if {@code payloadWildcardType} models a Java
2028     * {@linkplain java.lang.reflect.WildcardType wildcard type} and
2029     * not any other type, and if and only if {@code
2030     * receiverTypeVariable} models a {@linkplain
2031     * java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable type variable} and not any other
2032     * type.
2033     *
2034     * <p>This method is called by the {@link #assignable(Type, Type)}
2035     * method.</p>
2036     *
2037     * <p>This implementation returns {@code false} in all cases.
2038     *
2039     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
2040     * receiverTypeVariable}; often a {@link
2041     * java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
2042     *
2043     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code payloadWildcardType};
2044     * often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
2045     *
2046     * @param receiverTypeVariable the receiver type as described
2047     * above; must not be {@code null}
2048     *
2049     * @param payloadWildcardType the payload type as described above; must
2050     * not be {@code null}
2051     *
2052     * @param lowerBounded whether {@code payloadWildcardType} is a
2053     * lower-bounded wildcard type
2054     *
2055     * @return {@code false} in all cases
2056     *
2057     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
2058     * idempotent and deterministic.
2059     *
2060     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
2061     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
2062     *
2063     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
2064     */
2065    @OverridingEncouraged
2066    protected <X, Y> boolean typeVariableIsAssignableFromWildcardType(final Type<X> receiverTypeVariable,
2067                                                                      final Type<Y> payloadWildcardType,
2068                                                                      final boolean lowerBounded) {
2069      return false;
2070    }
2071
2072    private final <X, Y> boolean wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverWildcardType,
2073                                                                           final boolean lowerBounded,
2074                                                                           final Type<Y> payloadNonParameterizedType) {
2075      if (payloadNonParameterizedType.componentType() == null) {
2076        if (payloadNonParameterizedType.lowerBounded()) {
2077          return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverWildcardType, lowerBounded, payloadNonParameterizedType, true);
2078        } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.upperBounded()) {
2079          if (payloadNonParameterizedType.named()) {
2080            return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromTypeVariable(receiverWildcardType, lowerBounded, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2081          } else {
2082            return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverWildcardType, lowerBounded, payloadNonParameterizedType, false);
2083          }
2084        } else {
2085          return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverWildcardType, lowerBounded, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2086        }
2087      } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.type() == payloadNonParameterizedType) {
2088        return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverWildcardType, lowerBounded, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2089      } else {
2090        return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(receiverWildcardType, lowerBounded, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2091      }
2092    }
2093

2097     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
2098     * receiverWildcardType}, according to the assignability rules
2099     * modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance, and if and only if
2100     * {@code payloadClass} models a Java {@linkplain Class class} and
2101     * not any other type, and if and only if {@code
2102     * receiverWildcardType} models a {@linkplain

2104     * type.

2115     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
